description:
Launchpad, a people-first technology company, is a leader in North America´s rapidly growing tech sector. Through two solutions, Launchpad supports its clients with digital transformation:

  • PaasportTM, our iPaaS solution, streamlines software integration and automates workflows.
  • Nearshore Staff Augmentation, our managed IT staffing service, connects top IT talent across various geographical regions, bringing industry expertise to leading clients.

Based in Vancouver, Canada, our operational footprint spans across North and South America, with a second headquarters in Santiago, Chile.

In 2023, our unwavering dedication to innovation garnered recognition as a Deloitte Technology Fast 50™ Program Company. Our clientele boasts industry leaders such as Walmart, GM, TIME Magazine, Salesforce, Tableau, Splunk, Bolt.com, Freedom House, and more.

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then we’d love to hear from you.

We seek a skilled and experienced Intermediate Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate should possess a strong background in Java development, hands-on experience in quality assurance and testing, database management, and additional skills in web services and cloud solutions.

What will you do:

  • Develop robust and scalable software applications using Java, with a preference for version 11 and above.
  • Design and manage relational (PostgreSQL) and/or document databases, including data modeling and querying using SQL.
  • Conduct software testing activities to ensure the quality and reliability of developed applications.
  • Actively participate in all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and support.
  • Make sure applications are free of common coding vulnerabilities (and follow standard security practices).
  • Collaborate effectively with cross-geographical teams that include developers, testers, and product managers.
  • Positively contribute to the improvement of the team’s quality, efficiency, and capability.
  • Follow and contribute to your teams’ processes, best practices, methodologies, and guidelines.

Requirements:

  • 1 year of hands-on experience of IT quality assurance.
  • Experience in software testing (QA), ensuring the quality and reliability of developed applications.
  • 3 years of hands-on experience with building secure, scalable, performant, Java/Spring applications. (Version 11 and above.)
  • Experience working with spring boot is required
  • Strong knowledge of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and/or document databases, including data modeling and SQL querying.
  • Advanced proficiency in English.

Nice to have skills:

  • Knowledge/experience in Apache Camel/Integration including basic routing, error handling, split-aggregate, and dynamic routing.
  • Knowledge of web services protocols (SOAP, JSON, Rest API).
  • Understanding and experience with cloud solutions (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Knowledge of JSP, JSF, Angular, React, Struts, or similar front-end technologies
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • Relevant certifications (optional but preferred).

Why work for Launchpad?

  • 100% remote
  • People first culture
  • Excellent compensation in US Dollars
  • Hardware setup for working from home
  • Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia
  • Training allowances
  • Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.
  • ...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

Position Overview:

As a Senior Mulesoft Developer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and implementing integration solutions using Mulesoft. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Mulesoft development, with at least 3 years of hands-on experience. Experience in Java development is highly preferred. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver high-quality solutions that meet our clients' needs.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and implement Mulesoft integration solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Collaborate with architects, developers, and business analysts to understand technical requirements and translate them into scalable solutions.
  • Develop custom connectors, APIs, and integrations using Mulesoft Anypoint Platform - strong understanding of API design and integration patterns, experience with MuleSoft connectors, transformers, routers, and scopes, familiarity with RAML and/or Swagger for API documentation, knowledge of REST, SOAP, and other integration protocols
  • Write clean, maintainable code following best practices and coding standards.
  • Perform unit testing and debugging to ensure quality and reliability of code.
  • Provide technical guidance and support to junior developers as needed.
  • Stay updated on the latest Mulesoft features, tools, and best practices.
  • Proficiency with version control systems (e.g., Git) and collaborative development workflows.

 

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  • Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience with Mulesoft development.
  • Strong proficiency in Java programming language.
  • Experience with Mulesoft Anypoint Platform, including API Manager, Runtime Manager, and Anypoint Studio.
  • Solid understanding of integration patterns and best practices.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Mulesoft certification(s) is a plus.
  • Experience with other integration platforms such as Apache Camel or IBM Integration Bus.
  • Knowledge of cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

 

Why work for Launchpad?

  • 100% remote
  • People first culture
  • Excellent compensation in US Dollars
  • Hardware setup for working from home
  • Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia
  • Training allowances
  • Personal time off (PTO) for vacations, study leave, personal time, etc.
  • ...and more!

At Launchpad, we genuinely care about our people as individuals. If you are looking for a team that values growth, drive, and passion for your craft, if you’re seeking a place to achieve your goals and dreams with fairness and integrity, then you are the future of Launchpad. Launchpad is committed to fostering a diverse and representative workforce and an inclusive work environment where all employees are respected and treated equally.

Are you ready to elevate your career at Launchpad? We want to hear your story! Contact us today.

We are seeking a skilled Salesforce Administrator / Release Manager to join our team for a 3-month project, with potential for extension

Responsibilities:

  • Provision Salesforce sandboxes for development and testing purposes.
  • Create user accounts and manage permissions and access levels within Salesforce.
  • Plan and coordinate between Innovation Teams and Everyday Teams for the deployment of Salesforce changes.
  • Improve existing best practices for the joint Salesforce deployment between the new Innovation Teams and existing Everyday Teams.
  • Stay updated on the official Salesforce releases and participate in release night maintenance.
  • Manage Git repositories for Salesforce projects, including creating repositories, setting up branches, and maintaining repository organization.
  • Oversee branching strategies within Git to support development, testing, and production environments, ensuring alignment with project requirements and best practices.
  • Facilitate the merging of code changes between branches, resolving conflicts as necessary to maintain a clean and functional codebase.

Skills: 

  • 3 to 5 years of experience in similar roles. 
  • Salesforce Administrator certification.
  • Proven experience in Salesforce administration, including sandbox management, user account creation, and permission set assignments.
  • Strong understanding of Git version control system, including but not limited to: branching, merging, resolving conflicts, and pull requests.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing Salesforce metadata using version control, ensuring proper tracking and documentation of changes.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines in a Salesforce environment, integrating Git as a central component.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with teams across different departments.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.

  • Excellent compensation in US Dollars
  • Work with global teams and prominent brands based in North America, Europe, and Asia

What you’ll be doing:

  • Build and maintain data pipelines using Google BigQuery, Dataflow, and other distributed processing tools.
  • Calculate business-critical metrics that are used by executives and engineers to make prioritization decisions
  • Work with business teams to turn their analytics questions into data engineering solutions
  • Build a data platform that enables engineering teams to build and maintain their own distributed data pipelines
  • Train engineers and cross functional stakeholders on how to most effectively use the data tools at the organization
  • Identify opportunities to simplify workflows, automate tasks, and build components that are reusable across multiple use-cases and teams

Required Experience & Skills:

  • 6+ years experience in Data Engineering or back-end Software Engineering
  • Strong proficiency with Python and SQL
  • Experience with building and maintaining distributed data pipelines
  • Experience with MapReduce frameworks (Hadoop, Spark, BigQuery) and/or Apache Beam/Google Dataflow
  • Experience with workflow management tooling (eg. Airflow, Kubeflow Pipelines, Luigi)
  • Creative, resourceful, and enthusiastic about seeking new solutions to problems and opportunities
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS or GCP. Strong understanding of infrastructure management using IaC tools such as Terraform, Chef, Puppet or CloudFormation.
  • Experience authoring documentation for technical design, architecture and production runbooks.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD, e2e testing, deployment methods, and source control technologies and standards.
  • Experience working with Oracle modules (Procurement, Supply Chain, Maintenance) is a plus
  • Experience in data modeling, warehouse design and fact/dimension implementations

Leadership skills are crucial as the chosen candidate will lead the Drupal project within the team, working on exciting projects with cutting-edge technologies. Strong communication skills are a priority.

  • Design and implement custom modules in Drupal to meet project requirements.
  • Work on the development and maintenance of web applications using the Symphony framework.
  • Hands-on experience with Drupal 9 and 10 is a plus.
  • Collaborate with Front-End Developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
  • Ensure the performance, security, and scalability of web applications.
  • Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in back-end development.

Responsibilities:

  • Configure, deploy and maintain Cloud Infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as CloudFormation or Terraform
  • Collaborate with your peers as a subject matter expert on Cloud, Release Management, Datacenter Technologies, Automation, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), IaC, SysOps, and DevOps
  • Development of Release Management strategies for various architectures; Zero Downtime Deployments, Blue-Green, Canary Releases, etc.
  • Configuration and Management of Linux Servers to run custom-built applications using Configuration Management (CM) tooling such as Ansible or Chef
  • Working knowledge of Networking, and ability to implement secure cloud and hybrid networks.
  • Cognizance of security best practices
  • Implementation of monitoring for cloud and custom applications
  • Automation of deployment and release cycles using all of the above integrated into a
  • Continuous Integration and Delivery tool such as GitLab CI, etc
  • Configure and implement a variety of deployment mechanisms (blue/green, rolling updates, etc) automatically and route traffic accordingly.
  • Configure application deployments to automatically send all application logs, container logs, host logs, AWS resource logs.
  • Deploy applications in a highly available configuration such that critical applications will not fail, alerts will be triggered, and backup and failover systems will automatically come online when critical systems start failing.
  • Work closely with Architects, Developers, Security, and Clients to implement Cloud architecture that spans Serverless, Container, Server, component-based, and Hybrid utilizing industry best practices.

Skills:

  • BS degrees in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. 
  • 3+ years of experience as a Site Reliability Engineer, Production Engineer or Backend
  • Software Engineer for web-scale or similar platforms.
  • Experience with security tooling and best practices for implementation in development pipelines and infrastructure.
  • Experience with security event management, vulnerability management, intrusion detection and threat management systems
  • Experience with integrating applications
  • Experience with the development and support of major cloud infrastructure and platform services (AWS).
  • Experience with configuring continuous integration software and code pipelines (Gitlab, Jenkins).
  • Experience with container and container management, and security scanning technologies (EKS, ECS).
  • Experience collaborating with customer security teams, auditors, and external security consultants.
  • Experience with configuration management systems for cloud infrastructure and operating systems (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Demonstrated coding experience with an interpreted programming or scripting language (Python, Bash, PowerShell, JavaScript).
  • Experience with the Git source control system and ability to assist others in troubleshooting issues.
  • Experience in working with industry-leading IAM vendor products like SailPoint, Azure AD, Okta etc.
  • Understanding of Agile software development and management tools (Jira).
  • Deep hands-on understanding of High Availability, Scalability, Secure Cloud, Disaster Recovery, Release Management as implemented among various architectures eg: Serverless, Container, Server
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with Identity and Access Management solutions is nice-to-have

We are seeking a Network Engineer to join the Network Engineering & Security Team, that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our client’s global corporate, wireless, development, and production infrastructure within our data center networks and public clouds. 

The candidate will have a validated foundation and experience in supporting a diverse variety of environments. Such environments include enterprise campus LAN and WAN, branch office, wireless networks, hardware technology upgrades, and remote access. 

Strong customer service skills will be critical for this position, as the engineer will actively interact with stakeholders and fellow employees. The engineer will also support the daily operations of our client’s network infrastructure and services, including service metrics, projects, network upgrades, maintenance activities, and on-call rotation. 

Responsibilities 

  • Support global network, remote access, and wireless infrastructure to enable rapid company growth 
  • Participate in complex projects such as routed access, SDWAN, code upgrades, etc. 
  • Responsible for the installation, operation, administration, and maintenance of corporate LAN and WAN networks 
  • Support UCaaS service migration and author documents for support teams 
  • Work with the team on establishing network service metrics and scorecard 
  • Support the remote workforce with VPN and remote access issues 
  • Influence to plans and workflows for balanced growth and performance across all aspects of our client’s network infrastructure 
  • Partner with Facilities, Security, AV, etc. on office expansion and remodel projects 
  • Respond to network outages and perform deep root cause analysis 
  • Solve network connectivity issues 
  • Lead services SLA with timely trouble ticket resolution for end-user issues 
  • Support for network deployment and maintenance projects 
  • Author network documents and train support team on network technologies 
  • Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation 

Requirements 

  • 5+ years of network engineering experience supporting large, global, multi-vendor enterprise infrastructure 
  • Solid grasp of network fundamentals and operations 
  • Ability to explain complex technical situations with ease to stakeholders 
  • Meticulous and detail-oriented with outstanding documentation capability 
  • Proven knowledge in switching fundamentals such as Ethernet, VLANs, STP, HSRP, etc. 
  • Hands-on experience with Cisco IOS, IOS-XE, and NX-OS 
  • Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-facing production environment 
  • Experience building distributed systems and highly available services 
  • Experience with SNOW desired 
  • Experience with automation tools and scripting a plus 
  • Experience using network diagnosis and packet analysis tools 
  • Strong verbal and written interpersonal and communication skills 
  • Ability to work independently and solve problems with speed and efficiency 
  • Ability to self-motivate and handle, prioritize, challenging tasks 
  • Strong customer focus and service skills 
  • Attention to detail and accuracy 
  • Ability to work after hours to support projects and maintenance activities
  • Potential travel to support field office projects

The Programmer Analyst plays a critical role in improving the organization's efficiency and increasing the value delivered to customers.
